attack-object.name: Container and Resource Discovery
attack-object.comments: This control provides information about security best practices and policies to apply when deploying Google Kubernetes Engine.
attack-object.score-comment: By default, GKE nodes use Google's Container-Optimized OS to enhance the security of GKE clusters, including: Locked down firewall, read-only filesystem, limited user accounts, and disabled root login.

attack-object.comments: This control provides information about security best practices and policies to apply when deploying Google Kubernetes Engine.
attack-object.score-comment: GKE provides the ability to audit against a Center for Internet Security (CIS) Benchmark which is a set of recommendations for configuring Kubernetes to support a strong security posture. The Benchmark is tied to a specific Kubernetes release.

attack-object.name: Deploy Container
attack-object.comments: This control provides information about security best practices and policies to apply when deploying Google Kubernetes Engine.
attack-object.score-comment: Kubernetes role-based access control (RBAC), uses granular permissions to control access to resources within projects and objects within Kubernetes clusters.

attack-object.name: Container Orchestration Job
attack-object.comments: This control provides information about security best practices and policies to apply when deploying Google Kubernetes Engine.
attack-object.score-comment: GKE provides the ability to audit against a set of recommended benchmark [Center for Internet Security (CIS)]. This control may avoid privileged containers and running containers as root.

attack-object.name: Container Administration Command
attack-object.comments: This control provides information about security best practices and policies to apply when deploying Google Kubernetes Engine.
attack-object.score-comment: This control may provide provide information about vulnerabilities within container images, such as the risk from remote management of a deployed container. With the right permissions, an adversary could escalate to remote code execution in the Kubernetes cluster.

attack-object.name: Implant Internal Image
attack-object.comments: This control provides information about security best practices and policies to apply when deploying Google Kubernetes Engine.
attack-object.score-comment: After scanning for vulnerabilities, this control may alert personnel of tampered container images that could be running in a Kubernetes cluster.
